microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest MRT station (look for red/green/blue/yellow line signs)
Use Citymapper or Google Maps (excellent in Singapore)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Marina Bay, Gardens by the Bay, Orchard Road)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - Singapore is small and well-marked. MRT is efficient.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get EZ-Link card (S$5 deposit) - works on MRT/buses
S$0.83-2.50 per ride depending on distance
Tap card on reader before entering and exiting
MRT runs 5:30am-midnight, avoid rush hour 7-9am and 5-7pm
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis (expensive). MRT is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Taxis: meter required, expensive (S$10-20 short trips)
Walk between close MRT stations (save money)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use MRT for most trips. Taxis only for late night or specific destinations.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
actions: Hawker centers: S$3-8 (same food as restaurants)
Avoid expensive restaurants in Marina Bay
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Hawker centers are authentic and cheap.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: Tipping: Not expected (10% service charge included)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. Singapore restaurants are very accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: Visit a hawker center for a snack
Quick photo at Gardens by the Bay
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. Singapore is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Gardens by the Bay (outdoor areas free, visit 6am for cooler)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Singapore is very safe, but trust your instincts
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Singapore is one of the safest cities in the world, but stay alert.

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
actions: Very safe, but avoid fake electronics
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'No thanks' and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - English is the main language. Communication is easy.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. English works everywhere.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Singapore people are very helpful. English works everywhere.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Caf√© break (coffee S$3-5, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Orchard Road
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real Singapore is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR shopping OR nature
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a hawker center
Visit a local market and chat with vendors
Attend a local event (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book
